intro: Cyanella lutea f. angustior, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bluebell, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. The plant's unique morphology and striking floral display make it a notable species in its native range.
